Key Match Events: Angola's offensive change. Paz comes out and Mabululu takes his place.
Goal, goal, goal for Angola! A shot from the penalty spot that Mabululu sends into the back of the net.
Penalty for Angola! After a foul inside the area, the referee signals the penalty.
Pre-Game Insights: Algeria coach Djamel Belmadi spoke to the media: 'It is a huge pride to represent my country and lead this national team in incredible competitions like the AFCON and, at the same time, it is a huge responsibility...'

Pedro Gon√ßalves, Angola's coach, told the media: 'Let's do what we haven't done before, this is our main objective. We know that if we win twice, we qualify. We will see how far our performance and ability will take us, but I think we can qualify from the group and try to win the knockout stage...'
Post-Match Reflections: It's over! The match ends tied at one goal in this first game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Angola had a match prior to this one that they played against Congo, in this match neither of the two teams managed to take advantage and they ended up tied without goals, so they are in a bad mood emotionally.
Algeria beat Burundi four goals to zero in a friendly duel prior to the start of this competition, the players will go all out to score three in this match.
Others: The match will be broadcast on television on the TUDN channel.
Algeria vs Angola can be tuned from the ViX+ App channels.
